tweets.text: @Chisholm4Trail @RosieP4 @AquiferChalk @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @EnvAgency Trueüëç Separate sewerage systems are constructed in new developments but often connect into existing combined systemsüôÑcombined systems are often culverted streams within urban areas. Infiltration through leaking pipe joints or land drainage connections in high water table areas.

@AquiferChalk @Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @EnvAgency There needs to be a better understanding of the problem at *source*. If we properly segregated surface water from roofs, patios, & drives via SUDs so as to exclude from foul sewers, then pumping stations & treatment works would rarely be inundated and overflow. Cheaper that way?

@Feargal_Sharkey @WaterUK @EnvAgency Some junior exec, prompted by a more senior exec, is scrambling right now to find the password and stop the pre-programmed propaganda tweets set for the Easter weekend!üòÇ

The long-term plan for this area is being formed in a new Flood and Erosion Risk Management Strategy ‚Äì this is being funded by the @EnvAgency https://t.co/6bJNRxq3A2

We went down to the Aldersbrook today to check that the sewage discharges had fully stopped and to assess the damage to the brook and the River Roding. Absolutely shocked and saddened to discover that the discharges are still happening *9 days* after we first reported them. https://t.co/pvKK1VglKQ
